title: Fan Assembly
description: Schema for ASHRAE 205 annex RS0003: Fan Assembly

descriptions: Fan assemblies that operate at one or more defined speeds dictated by a tap or dip switch
Fan assemblies that operate within a continuous range of speeds
notes: Performance map data is provided at individual impeller speeds
Performance map data is provided over a range of impeller speeds

descriptions: Fan speed does not change after installation
Fan speed can change depending on operation after installation
notes: ***Informative note:*** Examples include dip-switch/tap selection and pulley adjustments

descriptions: Backward curved or inclined fan impeller
Air foil impeller with shaped blades
Fan impeller with shaft parallel to air flow stream for high static applications
Fan impeller with shaft parallel to air flow stream for low static pressure applications

notes: e.g., air-to-air heat exchanger

data_model.notes: Identifies the data model where the schema is defined

schema.notes: Identifies the schema used to define the data content

schema_version.description: Version of the root schema this data complies with

description.description: Description of data content (suitable for display)

id.notes: Assigned by *data publisher* to identify this data. `id` shall remain unchanged for revisions of the same data.

data_timestamp.notes: Date/time of publication of this data.

data_version.description: Integer version identifier for the data
data_version.notes: Used by *data publisher* to track revisions of the data. `data_version` shall be incremented for each data revision.

disclaimer.description: Characterization of accuracy, limitations, and applicability of this data

description.description: Data group describing product and rating information

model_number.notes: Pattern shall match all model numbers that can be represented by the representation

impeller_type.description: Type of impeller in fan assembly
descriptions: Backward curved or inclined fan impeller
Air foil impeller with shaped blades
Fan impeller with shaft parallel to air flow stream for high static applications
Fan impeller with shaft parallel to air flow stream for low static pressure applications

number_of_impellers.description: Number of impellers included in the fan assembly

nominal_standard_air_volumetric_flow_rat.description: Nominal or rated air flow rate at standard air conditions
nominal_standard_air_volumetric_flow_rat.notes: Used for calculating component wet pressure difference

is_enclosed.notes: True if the performance data reflects the static pressure difference across the enclosure

assembly_components.description: An array of components included in the fan assembly air stream, not including any fans

notes: e.g., air-to-air heat exchanger

component_id.description: Identifier of the corresponding Standard 205 representation
component_id.notes: Optionally provided if the component has a Standard 205 representation

wet_pressure_difference.description: Additional static pressure difference if the component is wet (e.g., because of condensate collection or wetting evaporative media)
notes: Corresponds to additional pressure difference at `nominal_standard_air_volumetric_flow_rate`
If unknown, a value of 75 Pa shall be used

heat_loss_fraction.description: Fraction of efficiency losses transferred into the air stream
heat_loss_fraction.notes: Used to determine amount of heat from the motor added to the air stream

stability_curve.description: The system curve defining the stability area for system selection
stability_curve.notes: ***Informative note:*** Application software may use this curve to indicate to application software users when a selected fan is operating in an unstable region where surging or stalling is likely to occur

standard_air_volumetric_flow_rate.description: Volumetric air flow rate through an air distribution system at standard air conditions

static_pressure_difference.description: Static pressure difference of an air distribution system

notes: Performance map data is provided at individual impeller speeds
Performance map data is provided over a range of impeller speeds
descriptions: Fan assemblies that operate at one or more defined speeds dictated by a tap or dip switch
Fan assemblies that operate within a continuous range of speeds

installation_speed_control_type.description: Type of fan impeller speed control
notes: ***Informative note:*** Examples include dip-switch/tap selection and pulley adjustments
descriptions: Fan speed does not change after installation
Fan speed can change depending on operation after installation

motor_representation.notes: If the fan assembly is packaged with a motor, a motor representation shall be provided

data_model.notes: Identifies the data model where the schema is defined

schema.notes: Identifies the schema used to define the data content

schema_version.description: Version of the root schema this data complies with

description.description: Description of data content (suitable for display)

id.notes: Assigned by *data publisher* to identify this data. `id` shall remain unchanged for revisions of the same data.

data_timestamp.notes: Date/time of publication of this data.

data_version.description: Integer version identifier for the data
data_version.notes: Used by *data publisher* to track revisions of the data. `data_version` shall be incremented for each data revision.

disclaimer.description: Characterization of accuracy, limitations, and applicability of this data

description.description: Data group describing product and rating information

model_number.notes: Pattern shall match all model numbers that can be represented by the representation

maximum_power.description: Maximum operational input power to the motor
maximum_power.notes: Operational limit set to prevent overheating or overcurrent, not the rated name plate power

standby_power.description: Power draw when motor is not operating

data_model.notes: Identifies the data model where the schema is defined

schema.notes: Identifies the schema used to define the data content

schema_version.description: Version of the root schema this data complies with

description.description: Description of data content (suitable for display)

id.notes: Assigned by *data publisher* to identify this data. `id` shall remain unchanged for revisions of the same data.

data_timestamp.notes: Date/time of publication of this data.

data_version.description: Integer version identifier for the data
data_version.notes: Used by *data publisher* to track revisions of the data. `data_version` shall be incremented for each data revision.

disclaimer.description: Characterization of accuracy, limitations, and applicability of this data

description.description: Data group describing product and rating information

model_number.notes: Pattern shall match all model numbers that can be represented by the representation

maximum_power.description: Maximum power draw of the drive

standby_power.description: Power draw when the motor is not operating

cooling_method.description: Method used to cool the drive
descriptions: Drive is cooled using natural air convection within the surrounding environment
Drive is cooled using forced air convection within the surrounding environment
Drive is cooled using forced liquid convection, transferring heat to the liquid
notes: All drive efficiency losses are assumed to be added as heat to the surrounding environment
Electrical power required for the active cooling system shall be included in the efficiency of the drive
All drive efficiency losses are assumed to be added as heat to the surrounding environment
Any liquid pumping power shall be modeled external to the drive by the application software
All drive efficiency losses are assumed to be added as heat to the liquid stream

performance_map.description: Data group describing drive performance when operating
Data group describing motor performance when operating
notes: If no performance map is defined, the motor shall be assumed to transfer all electric power directly to mechanical shaft power
***Informative note:*** This field may be omitted for motor-driven equipment where motor efficiencies are incorporated into their performance data

mechanical_drive_representation.description: The corresponding Standard 205 mechanical drive representation
mechanical_drive_representation.notes: If the fan assembly is packaged with a mechanical drive, a mechanical drive representation shall be provided

data_model.notes: Identifies the data model where the schema is defined

schema.notes: Identifies the schema used to define the data content

schema_version.description: Version of the root schema this data complies with

description.description: Description of data content (suitable for display)

id.notes: Assigned by *data publisher* to identify this data. `id` shall remain unchanged for revisions of the same data.

data_timestamp.notes: Date/time of publication of this data.

data_version.description: Integer version identifier for the data
data_version.notes: Used by *data publisher* to track revisions of the data. `data_version` shall be incremented for each data revision.

disclaimer.description: Characterization of accuracy, limitations, and applicability of this data

description.description: Data group describing product and rating information

model_number.notes: Pattern shall match all model numbers that can be represented by the representation

speed_ratio.description: Ratio of input shaft speed to output shaft speed

performance_map.description: Data group describing drive performance when operating
Data group describing fan assembly performance when operating

grid_variables.description: Data group describing grid variables for continuous fan performance

standard_air_volumetric_flow_rate.description: Volumetric air flow rate through fan assembly at standard air conditions

static_pressure_difference.description: External static pressure across fan assembly at dry coil conditions
static_pressure_difference.notes: Any static pressure deduction (or addition) for wet coil is specified by `wet_pressure_difference` in 'assembly_components' data group

lookup_variables.description: Data group describing lookup variables for continuous fan performance

shaft_power.description: Mechanical shaft power input to fan assembly
shaft_power.notes: Does not include the mechanical efficiency of any mechanical drive used to modify rotational speed between the motor and impeller

grid_variables.description: Data group describing grid variables for discrete fan performance

speed_number.description: Number indicating discrete speed of fan impeller in rank order (with 1 being the lowest speed)
speed_number.notes: Data shall be provided for all allowable discrete speeds or settings

static_pressure_difference.description: External static pressure across fan assembly at dry coil conditions
static_pressure_difference.notes: Any static pressure deduction (or addition) for wet coil is specified by `wet_pressure_difference` in 'assembly_components' data group

lookup_variables.description: Data group describing lookup variables for discrete fan performance

standard_air_volumetric_flow_rate.description: Volumetric air flow rate through fan assembly at standard air conditions

shaft_power.description: Mechanical shaft power input to fan assembly
shaft_power.notes: Does not include the mechanical efficiency of any mechanical drive used to modify rotational speed between the motor and impeller

model_number.notes: Pattern shall match all model numbers that can be represented by the representation
